result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond S Schweissinger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat, Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended

Absolute sobriety, random UA's

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent

To be compliant with the family court orders regarding contact with the victim/children

Domestic Violence Counseling through a state certified batterers intervention program

Anger management

No dangerous weapons (e.g. knives, firearms, etc.)
Full-time employment and/or combination of schooling

Case called at 9:03 a.m.
Attorney Alyssa Jay in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Raymond S Schweissinger in court.  
Victim appeared in court.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Victim makes statements.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
45-Days Jail
Credit time 2-days, if Revoked
Sentence is to run Consecutive to Counts 2 and 3
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  2 YEARS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.'s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
Full-Time employment and/or combination of schooling
To be Compliant with the Family Court orders regarding contact with the victim/children
Domestic Violence Counseling through a State certified batterers intervention program
Anger Management
No Dangerous Weapons (e.g. Knives, firearms, etc.)

COSTS:  $243.00
DOMESTIC ABUSE SURCHARGE:  $100.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Appeal rights given.

COUNT 2
Court orders the following:
6 months Jail
Sentence is to run Consecutive to Counts 1 and 3
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  2 YEARS

Anger Management
No Dangerous Weapons (e.g. Knives, firearms, etc.)

COSTS:  $243.00
DOMESTIC ABUSE SURCHARGE:  $100.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: TOTAL SENTENCE is 90-DAYS HUBER (Standard Release Conditions)
Defendant is to serve the first 30-days Huber commencing 11-11-2022 by 5:00 p.m.
The balance of the sentence is to be STAYED for the Agent's use. 

COUNT 3
Court orders the following:
45-Days Jail

Case called at 8:13 a.m. for Jury Trial
Attorney Alyssa Jay and Shawn Woller in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Raymond S Schweissinger in court. 
Court discusses the voir dire and preliminary jury instructions.
Court calls for the jurors at 8:40 a.m. Jurors enter the courtroom at 8:51 a.m.
Clerk swears in the jurors for voir dire.  Court conducts voir dire.
Jurors 9 and 17 are struck for cause. Juror 20 struck for cause. Juror 21 struck for cause.
Court takes a break at 10:21 a.m.  Court reconvenes at 10:30 a.m.
Same appearances.  Jurors in courtroom.  Counsel and Defendant exercise strikes.
Court announces the names of the jurors to hear this case.
Clerk swears in the jurors to try the issues. 
Court reads the preliminary jury instructions to the jury.
Court takes a break at 11:08 a.m.  Court takes a recess.
Court reconvenes at 11:19 a.m.  Jurors enter the courtroom.
Opening statements made by the State.  
Opening statements made  by the Defendant.
State calls Sheri Schweissinger sworn and testified.
Direct-examination by the State.  Exhibits 1 and 2 marked, offered, and received.
Exhibits 3, 4, 5, 6, and 7 marked, offered, and received.
Court excuses the jurors for a lunch break at 12:02 p.m.  Court is in recess.
Court reconvenes at 1:21 p.m.  Same appearances.  
Jurors enter the courtroom at 1:27 p.m.
Cross-examination by the Defendant.  Re-direct by the State.
State calls Officer Carly Rawson sworn and testified.  
Direct-examination by the State.  No-Cross examination by the Defendant.
State calls Officer Paxton Bergin sworn and testified.
Direct-examination by the State.  Cross-examination by the Defendant.
State rests.  Jurors are excused at 2:08 p.m.
Court has a discussion with the State and defendant regarding jury instructions.
Court reconvenes at 2:45 p.m.  Same appearances.
Jurors enter the courtroom at 2:46 p.m.  
Defendant takes the witness stand sworn and testified.
Defendant testifies.  Cross-examination by the State.
Defense rests.  Testimony is closed.
Court reads the Jury Instructions.   Court excuses the jury at 3:19 p.m.
Court takes a recess.  Court reconvenes at 3:25 p.m.  Jury enters the courtroom.
Closing arguments made by the State.  Closing arguments made by the Defendant.
Rebuttal closing arguments made by the State.
Court reads the final instructions.  Jurors go to deliberate at 3:45 p.m.
Verdict reached at 4:36 p.m.  Court reconvenes at 4:45 p.m.
Same appearances.  Jurors enter the courtroom at 4:46 p.m.
Clerk reads the verdict.  Jury finds the Defendant Guilty on all 3 counts.
Court polls the jury.  State moves for Judgment on the Verdict.
Court enters Judgment on the Verdict.  Court schedules the sentencing date.
Bail remains as previously set.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
